column3:
The initialization takes care that the node will not be started as long as the chain tip is NULL (see #5243). So this is not a case that should happen.

Maybe add an `assert(tip)` instead?
Done - it still core dumps, but it's clear about where the failure was, at least (i.e. you don't have to dig out gdb to trace down what went wrong).\n
Well it _is_ meant to be fatal if it gets there with a NULL chaintip. Dumping core on abort() is a feature, not a bug.\nutACK\n
